授業目的:
In this course, will look at environmental problems, and the responses to them by different governments around the world, with special focus on the EU.
This course will raise your awareness of the many impacts our consumption has around the world. It helps you understand how globalised our world is.
You will learn responses against environmental problems by governments, NGOs, citizens and companies, and analyse their effectiveness.
到達目標:
Over the course, you will acquire or improve the following skills:
Critical, independent thinking; environmental awareness; evaluation of policies and actions; academic writing skills; discussion skills
授業方法:
Seminar-style with active student participation, including group work & presentations. on LUNA
DUE TO CURRENT ENTRY RESTRICTIONS TO JAPAN, THIS COURSE WILL TAKE PLACE ONLINE (ON DEMAND). The materials for the classes will be uploaded on LUNA every week by Wednesday, 3rd period.

第1回: Introduction: Environmental problems around the world
第3回: Environmental awareness in different EU countries
第4回: Plastic pollution: Is recycling working? Is recycling really environmentally friendly?
第5回: Global efforts to curb plastic waste
第6回:
Marine pollution and overfishing
What is happening with our waste? Can our oceans survive?
第7回:
Food waste & landfills
European attempts to reduce food waste
第8回: E-waste and other hazardous waste disposal: where do our old phones end up?
第9回: Fast fashion and its impact on the environment. Examples from EU countries
第11回: Should we all be vegans? (Cattle) farming's impact on the environment (soil pollution, water pollution, atmospheric pollution, C02 emissions, deforestation, biodiversity etc.)
第12回: Palm oil: should it be banned? Rainforest destruction in Indonesia
第13回: Attempts to help our environment: what countries, cities, NGOs, individuals & companies do
